title: Anomaly Detection: Saudi Arabia
content:
If the user is in Saudi Arabia, check machine overheating anomaly:
 - If Temperature ≥ 60°C OR Flow rate ≤ 20 L/min, there's anomaly
 - number(Digit1, Temp), number(Digit2, Flow)
embedding_text: Saudi Arabia country Middle East machine overheating temperature flow rate anomaly detection Arabic region Gulf states thermal monitoring industrial equipment

title: Anomaly Detection: Iraq
content:
If the user is in Iraq, heat exchanger anomaly:
 - If the inlet temperature is lower than the outlet temperature, it indicates that the heat exchanger insulation has failed, the flow rate is abnormal, or the heat transfer medium is mixed.
 - number(Digit1, Inlet), number(Digit2, Outlet)
embedding_text: Iraq country Middle East Mesopotamia heat exchanger thermal equipment inlet outlet temperature insulation failure flow rate heat transfer anomaly detection Arabic nation Baghdad

title: Anomaly Detection: India
content:
If the user is in India, check power overload anomaly:
 - If sum of branch currents > 120A, there's anomaly
 - number(Digit1, Current1), number(Digit2, Current2)
embedding_text: India country South Asia subcontinent power electrical overload current ampere branch circuit electrical system anomaly detection Hindi Telugu Kannada Devanagari regional languages

title: Anomaly Detection: Pakistan
content:
If the user is in Pakistan, Monitor compressor pressure ratio (plus bias): Calculate R = (P_out + 1) / (P_in + 1). When R < 0.7 or R > 4.2, it is considered abnormal (it may be a valve stuck or compressor wear).
- number(Digit1, P_out): original outlet pressure (unit: bar)
- number(Digit2, P_in): original inlet pressure (unit: bar)
embedding_text: Pakistan country Asia compressor pressure ratio anomaly detection P_out P_in bias offset add one outlet inlet pressure ratio threshold valve stuck wear industrial monitoring
